page.title: 13The Church in North Leigh
page.content:
Saint Mary's church was in my block. We spent about ten minutes in the church. In memory of people who had belonged to the parish, there were cushions, on which their names were embroidered.The Saxons built the church in 1040. The Normans later added another part. The church has wooden benches. It is situated on the outskirts of North Leigh and it belongs to the Church of England. There were lots of flowers in the church on the day we visited, because there had been a flower festival the weekend before.
by Ralph Evans
